text: When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the â€œLost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Since humanity first walked on the Earth, they have always feared the inevitable, that is their own death and what may lie afterwards. Countless have tried to prolong their lives, even attempt to achieve immortality. All had been unsuccessful, until the year 2122, when a medical breakthrough was achieved. A pharmaceutical company, called MedLife had created a supplement, that when ingested, would let people live forever, or so they claim.

Since humanity first walked on the Earth, they have always feared the inevitable, that is their own death and what may lie afterwards. Countless have tried to prolong their lives, even attempt to achieve immortality. All had been unsuccessful, until the year 2122, when a medical breakthrough was achieved. A pharmaceutical company, called MedLife had created a supplement, that when ingested, would let people live forever, or so they claim. This supplement, known as the "Immortality Pill" was a great success, and soon became a global phenomenon.

Since humanity first walked on the Earth, they have always feared the inevitable, that is their own death and what may lie afterwards. Countless have tried to prolong their lives, even attempt to achieve immortality. All had been unsuccessful, until the year 2122, when a medical breakthrough was achieved. A pharmaceutical company, called MedLife had created a supplement, that when ingested, would let people live forever, or so they claim. Despite skepticism by some, the supplement, known as the "Immortality Pill" was a great success, and soon became a global phenomenon.

It is the year 2123, and a good portion of the world had ingested the immortality pill. The pill granted them eternal youth, and the ability to live life free of disease. For the most part, it seemed to work well for the users. Many showed an improvement in their lives, being more active and healthy overall. There seemed to be no negative side effects either, and MedLife made a good fortune on their miracle drug.

200 years later, and it is currently the year 2223. Most of the Earth's population has stagnated, being around 9 billion in total. Many are have grown into their hundreds, with some having just turned into 200+ years this year. Like the drug promised, it had extended their lives far greater than they would have lived without it.

Since humanity first walked on the Earth, they have always feared the inevitable, that is their own death and what may lie afterwards. Countless have tried to prolong their lives, even attempt to achieve immortality. All had been unsuccessful, until the year 2122, when a medical breakthrough was achieved. A pharmaceutical company, called MedLife had created a supplement, that when ingested, would let people live forever, or so they claim. Despite skepticism by some, the supplement, known as the "Immortality Pill" was a great success, and soon became a global phenomenon.

It is the year 2123, and a good portion of the world had ingested the immortality pill. The pill granted them eternal youth, and the ability to live life free of disease. For the most part, it seemed to work well for the users. Many showed an improvement in their lives, being more active and healthy overall. There seemed to be no negative side effects either, and MedLife made a good fortune on their miracle drug.

200 years later, and it is currently the year 2223. Most of the Earth's population has stagnated, being around 9 billion in total. Many are have grown into their hundreds, with some having just turned into 200+ years this year. Like the drug promised, it had extended their lives far greater than they would have lived without it.  However, the drug had a side effect that was not mentioned in the original advertisements, nor was it expected from MedLife. After 100 years, the drug would lose its efficiency, creating a tolerance in the individual. The person would then begin to age, but still found themselves living for the time being. MedLife attempted to create another drug that would recreate the effects of the immortality pill in the users that built a tolerance to it, but found it was no use.

For the most part, it seemed to work well for the users. Many showed an improvement in their lives, being more active and healthy overall. MedLife attempted to create another drug that would recreate the effects of the immortality pill in the users that built a tolerance to it, but found it was no use. The world had become a place of stagnation. The majority of the population was aging, as most had thought against the idea of raising a family, much less having new children. What children did existed were prevented from taking the immortality drug, as they feared that humanity would die off in time if the next generation received it as well.

For the most part, it seemed to work well for the users. Many showed an improvement in their lives, being more active and healthy overall. 200 years later, and it is currently the year 2223. Most of the Earth's population has stagnated, being around 9 billion in total. What children did existed were prevented from taking the immortality drug, as they feared that humanity would die off in time if the next generation received it as well. The immortals of the current year would likely die in due time finally due to old age, but they hoped that the next generation would have enough time to be raised right. They wanted them to avoid making the same mistakes they did, for them to not fear the inevitable and seek to prolong their lives beyond what is natural. For humanity almost died when it achieved immortality,
